items.title: AI Night Challenge 3rd Edition
items.description: Won the prize in the ARSII Data Science Contest with the project "SmartEval: Système d'Évaluation Intelligente pour un Apprentissage Interactif." This marked the user's third participation, showcasing expertise in developing intelligent and interactive learning evaluation systems in collaboration with another team.
items.description2:
Award-Winning Data Science Project – ARSII ARSII Data Science Contest.
  • Won the prize at the ARSII Data Science Contest with the project "SmartEval: Système d'Évaluation Intelligente pour un Apprentissage Interactif", showcasing expertise in developing intelligent and interactive learning evaluation systems.
  • Designed a scalable AI-driven solution to transform traditional evaluation methods into personalized and adaptive learning experiences.
  • Integrated machine learning algorithms to provide real-time performance analysis and customized feedback for learners.
  • Achieved this recognition in the third participation in the contest, reflecting consistent growth and excellence in data science.

items.title: IEEE CS TSYP11 : 2nd Prize
items.description: Secured 2nd prize in the TSYP 11 IEEE CS Challenge for the project "Deep-fake Forensics TSYP11 CS." Led the team to achieve the first-ever prize for the IEEE ENSIT Student Branch. Demonstrated expertise in AI-based deepfake detection techniques. Played a pivotal role in team leadership and project execution.
items.description2:
Secured 2nd prize in the TSYP 11 IEEE CS Challenge for the project "Deep-fake Forensics TSYP11 CS." Led the team to achieve the first-ever prize for the IEEE ENSIT Student Branch. Demonstrated expertise in AI-based deepfake detection techniques. Played a pivotal role in team leadership and project execution.
  • Demonstrated expertise in AI-based deepfake detection techniques, developing innovative solutions to identify and combat deepfake content.
  • Played a pivotal role in team leadership, ensuring efficient collaboration and successful project execution.
  • Showcased technical skills and problem-solving abilities in a competitive environment, contributing to the team's remarkable achievement.

items.title: AI Night Challenge 2nd Edition
items.description: Won the prize in the ARSII Data Science Contest with the project "AI News Radar" by Pristini The AI Univesity This marked the user's second participation, the contest consist of developing an application that allows users to check for the recent AI related news. I've used web scrapping and machine learning to predict the veracity of the news, then displaying in the Streamlit web application.
items.description2:
Prize Winner – ARSII ARSII Data Science Contest
  • Won the prize in the ARSII Data Science Contest with the project "AI News Radar", developed under the banner of Pristini – The AI University.
  • Participated in the contest for the second time, creating an application that enables users to access the latest AI-related news.
  • Utilized web scraping techniques to aggregate news from various sources and applied machine learning models to predict the veracity of the news, ensuring reliability and trustworthiness.
  • Designed and deployed the solution as a Streamlit web application, offering a user-friendly interface for seamless interaction.
  • Demonstrated expertise in data science, machine learning, and application development, addressing real-world challenges in information verification and accessibility.

items.title: IEEE ESSTHS : Game On
items.description: Achieved 2nd place in the IEEE ESSTHS Game Development Contest by creating a 3D survival shooter game. Developed the game within 8 hours using templates and examples, showcasing quick adaptability and creativity under time constraints.
items.description2: Achieved 2nd place in the IEEE ESSTHS Game Development Contest by creating a 3D survival shooter game. Developed the game within 8 hours using templates and examples, showcasing quick adaptability and creativity under time constraints.

items.title: GEEKS Hack 2.0
items.description:
Scared To Compile team earned 2nd place in the 24-hour Hackathon organized by the ENSIT
                            Geeks Club, demonstrating
                            strong problem-solving skills and effective performance under time pressure.
items.description2:
2nd Place – 24-Hour Hackathon, ENSIT Geeks Club
  • Achieved 2nd place as part of the Scared To Compile team in the 24-hour Hackathon organized by the ENSIT Geeks Club.
  • Collaborated with team members Amenallah Ben Amor and Mohamed Amin Bachka to deliver a competitive solution under tight time constraints.
  • Demonstrated exceptional problem-solving skills, creativity, and the ability to perform effectively under pressure.
  • Contributed to the design and development of innovative solutions within a collaborative and high-stakes environment.

items.title: IEEEXtreme 16.0
items.description: With team Keranis, earned the title of Second Best Team at ENSIT and ranked among the top 70 teams in the Tunisia Section during the IEEEXtreme 16.0 programming competition, showcasing exceptional coding and teamwork skills.

items.title: IEEE FST Hackathon
items.description: Achieved 2nd place in the 24-hour problem-solving Hackathon organized by IEEE FST at the City of Science in Tunis, demonstrating strong analytical and collaborative skills under pressure.
items.description2:
2nd Place – 24-Hour Problem-Solving Hackathon, IEEE FST
  • Secured 2nd place as part of Team W101 in the 24-hour problem-solving Hackathon organized by IEEE FST at the City of Science in Tunis.
  • Collaborated with team members Rebai Firas and Ben Othman Rami to deliver innovative and efficient solutions within the competition's time constraints.
  • Demonstrated exceptional analytical thinking, teamwork, and the ability to perform effectively under pressure.
  • Contributed to solving complex challenges, showcasing technical expertise and collaborative problem-solving in a competitive environment.

items.title: Best Scientific Article for IEEE Tunisia Section 2023
items.description:
Won the IEEE Tunisia Section Student Paper Contest 2023 with the paper titled "Implementation for Data Science Aspect on the U-Book App." The paper highlighted innovative data science integration in application development.
Competed among top student researchers in Tunisia. Award included certification, TSYP Congress registration, and qualification for the IEEE Region 8 SPC.
Link for the Competition Check the paper
items.description2:
Winner – IEEE Tunisia Section Student Paper Contest 2023
  • Awarded 1st place in the IEEE Tunisia Section Student Paper Contest 2023 for the paper titled "Implementation for Data Science Aspect on the U-Book App."
  • The paper showcased innovative integration of data science techniques in application development, highlighting advancements in intelligent and efficient system design.
  • Competed against top student researchers in Tunisia, demonstrating academic excellence and technical expertise.
  • Received a certificate of recognition, TSYP Congress registration, and qualification to represent Tunisia in the prestigious IEEE Region 8 Student Paper Contest.
  • Solidified reputation as a skilled researcher with the ability to apply cutting-edge technologies to real-world challenges.

items.title: PEEC Innov'Startup 2.0 Final
items.description: Participated in the Innov'startup 2.0 entrepreneurship competition organized by the Pôle Étudiant Entrepreneur de Carthage (PEEC) with the Ubook project. Successfully advanced through all qualification stages and reached the final, where they placed 5th out of 120 projects. The final took place at Sup'Com, with the semifinals held at INSAT.
items.description2:
5th Place – Innov'startup 2.0 Entrepreneurship Competition
  • Reached the finals of the competition, competing against the best entrepreneurial projects from across the country.
  • Secured 5th place overall, showcasing the Ubook project as a standout in terms of innovation, feasibility, and market potential.
  • Delivered a well-prepared final presentation to a distinguished panel of judges, highlighting the project’s unique features and growth strategy.
  • Engaged with other top entrepreneurs, gaining valuable insights into business development and networking with potential investors and collaborators.
  • Demonstrated an ability to perform under pressure, effectively presenting the project in a highly competitive environment, and received positive feedback on its innovative approach.

items.title: EFE Contest
items.description: Competed in the EFE entrepreneurship contest, winning the first qualification to the finals and securing 4th place in the final round, demonstrating strong entrepreneurial skills and innovative thinking.
items.description2:
4th Place – EFE Entrepreneurship Contest
  • Competed in the EFE Entrepreneurship Contest, advancing through the initial rounds by winning the first qualification to the finals.
  • Secured 4th place in the final round, showcasing strong entrepreneurial skills, innovative thinking, and the ability to develop impactful solutions.
  • Demonstrated expertise in project pitching, business strategy, and problem-solving within a competitive entrepreneurial environment.
  • Highlighted creative approaches to addressing real-world challenges, earning recognition among top participants.
